InstructionData.Title: PSA - Power Saving Airlock
InstructionData.Author: onebit
InstructionData.Instructions:
# PSA-100 # Power Saving Airlock v1.0 # # Connect the airlock console and two # back pressure regulators to the IC. # After you use the airlock the regulators # will turn on for a short period to # make sure your pipes don't explode. # # PSA: you can turn off the console to save power alias Console d0 # airlock console alias IntReg d1 # interior back pressure regulator alias ExtReg d2 # exterior
alias device r0 alias setting r1 alias lastsetting r2 alias count r3 alias maxticks r4
define EXTTICKS 10 # run exterior ticks define INTTICKS 20 # run interior ticks
# wait for console setting to change start: yield move lastsetting setting l setting Console Setting beq setting lastsetting start beq 5 setting extopen beq 2 setting intopen j start
# exterior door is open, drain interior extopen: move device 1 # IntReg move maxticks INTTICKS j drain
# interior door is open, drain exterior intopen: move device 2 # ExtReg move maxticks EXTTICKS j drain
drain: s dr0 On 1 # turn on reg move count 0
drainloop: yield add count count 1 s db Setting count blt count maxticks drainloop s dr0 On 0 # turn off reg j start
